content: spree socks by kemper wray/junkyarn designs quick knit socks in dk or worsted weight yarn make amazing gifts for family and friends or a cozy treat for your own feet spree socks by kemper wray materials roughly 100 grams of any dk or worsted weight yarn -­ -­ suggested yarns blimp dk from the flying kettle shown in kitsch christmas 250 yards/100 grams sw merino worsted from spun right round shown in blitzed 218 yards/100 grams dk weight version -­ worsted weight version -­ us size 3/3 25mm circs or dpns us size 4/3 5mm circs needles or dpns us size 4/3 5mm circs or dpns us size 5/3 75mm circular needles or dpns tapestry needle 1 stitch marker gauge 6 stitches per inch and 8 row per inch for both weights of yarn * i am a very tight knitter so this gauge is a reflection of my knitting style if you are a loose knitter making the worsted weight version you may want to use the smaller needles to achieve the correct gauge again gauge is largely dependent on the knitter so swatch if necessary sizes small medium large small accommodates feet less than 8 5-­ 9 inches in circumference medium accommodates feet 9-­ 9 5 inches in circumference large accommodates feet larger than 9 5 inches in circumference and larger abbreviations k = knit p= purl sl1 pw = slip one stitch as if to purl purlwise k2tog = knit two stitches together p2tog = purl two stitches together ssk = slip 2 stitches then knit these two stitches together sock pattern cuff co 44 48 52 stitches using the long tail cast on or your preferred cast on for socks using smaller needles knit 10 row or approximately 1 inch in *k1 p1* rib for cuff change to larger needles and knit 18 row or approximately 2 inches in stockinette stitch if you are a loose knitter change back to smaller needles for heel flap and turn this ensures that the heel fits snuggly to your foot if you would prefer a roomier house sock continue with larger needles for flap to begin heel flap arrange half of your stitches 22 24 26 on one needle half will be your instep top of foot and half will be the sole stitches heel flap flap row 1 rs *sl1 pw k1* all the way across flap row 2 ws sl1 pw p all stitches across repeat row 1 and 2 eleven times you ll know you ve worked eleven repeats when you have eleven slipped stitches on the side of the flap end with a right side row 1 heel turn turn row 1 ws p13 p2tog p1 turn your work turn row 2 rs sl1 k5 ssk k1 turn your work turn row 3 ws sl1 purl to 1 stitch before turn p2tog p1 turn your work turn row 4 rs sl1 knit to 1 stitch before turn k2tog k1 turn your work continue
